intro: Barollaea, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species native to southern Africa, characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Barollaea species are often found in rocky or sandy soils, and they play a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators. Their botanical features make them interesting subjects for study in plant ecology and evolution.
